Package ca.cgjennings.ui.theme

Class AbstractBaseTheme

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.theme.Theme
ca.cgjennings.ui.theme.AbstractBaseTheme
public abstract class AbstractBaseTheme extends Theme
An abstract base class for creating new themes that are variants of the built-in themes. Methods are provided that allow you to create a theme with an alternative colour scheme with a minimum of effort.
Since:
3.0

  • Method Details

    • useAlpha

      protected void useAlpha​(boolean obeyAlphaBits)
      Sets whether translucency is used when setting colour values. By default, the alpha bits of the colour values passed to various protected "set" methods are ignored. This method can be used to change this; specifying true will caused the highest 8 bits of colour values to be used for the alpha value.
      Parameters:
      obeyAlphaBits - if true, colour values are interpreted as ARGB values rather than RGB values

    • initializeTheme

      protected abstract void initializeTheme()
      This is called to allow subclasses to customize the theme by calling the base theme's various protected "set" methods.

    • setBackgroundBase

      protected void setBackgroundBase​(int argb)
      Sets the base background colour. This primarily affects the background colour of panels and menus.
      Parameters:
      argb - RGB value of the base colour to use

    • setForegroundBase

      protected void setForegroundBase​(int argb)
      Sets the base colour used for controls. This primarily affects the colour of buttons and combo boxes.
      Parameters:
      argb - RGB value of the base colour to use

    • setFocusRingBase

      protected void setFocusRingBase​(int argb)
      Sets the base colour used for the ring drawn around the control that has input focus.
      Parameters:
      argb - RGB value of the base colour to use

    • setContrastBase

      protected void setContrastBase​(int argb)
      Sets the base colour used as a contrasting colour with the foreground base. Used primarily by progress bars.
      Parameters:
      argb - RGB value of the base colour to use

    • matchFont

      protected static Font matchFont​(String families, int style, int size)
      Returns the font that is the best match for the given specification. The font is specified using a comma-separated list of font family names. The first font family that is available will be used; if no font in the list is available, then a default sans serif font family is used.
      Parameters:
      families - a comma-separated list of font family names
      style - the font style bitmap, as per Font(java.lang.String, int, int)
      size - the point size of the font
      Returns:
      a font with the specified size and style whose family is the first family in the list that is installed on this system
      See Also:
      ResourceKit.findAvailableFontFamily(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

    • set

      protected void set​(String key, Object value)
      Sets the value of an arbitrary look and feel default key. This can be used to customize aspects of the theme that cannot be modified via existing helper methods.
      Parameters:
      key - the key name of the default to modify
      value - the value of the default to modify
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the key is null or empty

    • getLookAndFeelClassName

      public final String getLookAndFeelClassName()
      Returns the look and feel class name. Subclasses may override this to use a custom look and feel.

      AbstractBaseTheme makes this method final, so the underlying look and feel cannot be changed.

      Overrides:
      getLookAndFeelClassName in class Theme
      Returns:
      the name of a LookAndFeel subclass

    • modifyManagerDefaults

      public final void modifyManagerDefaults​(UIDefaults defaults)
      Description copied from class: Theme
      This method is called prior to instantiating the look and feel and allows you to modify the UI manager's default properties.
      Specified by:
      modifyManagerDefaults in class Theme
      Parameters:
      defaults - the UIManager defaults
